nameEntry.part: Inquiry into the Implementation of the Recommendations of the Lost Innocents and Forgotten Australians Reports

biogHist.abstract:
In September 2008, the Senate referred the following matter to the Community Affairs Committee for inquiry and report:
'Progress with the implementation of the recommendations in the reports by the Community Affairs References Committee, Lost Innocents: Righting the Record, a report on child migration tabled in August 2001, and Forgotten Australians, a report on Australians who experienced institutional or out-of-home care as children tabled in August 2004.'
The committee's report, 'Lost Innocents and Forgotten Australians Revisited', was released in June 2009.

descriptiveNote.p: In 2008, the Community Affairs Committee commenced an inquiry into the implementation of the recommendations from the Lost Innocents report, which came out of the Inquiry into Child Migration.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Inquiry into Children in Institutional Care (2003 - 2005)

descriptiveNote.p: In 2008, the Community Affairs Committee commenced an inquiry into the implementation of the recommendations from the Forgotten Australians report, which came out of the 2003 Inquiry into Children in Institutional Care.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse, Commonwealth Government
